description: An example resource schema demonstrating some basic constructs and validation rules.

Type.description: Type of recurrence, choose from: days, weeks, months, years

WeekDays.description: A list of week days to repeat on; first letter must be capitalized

UntilDate.description: The date at which the recurrence should end as a POSIX timestmap; mutually exclusive with UntilOccurrences

UntilOccurrences.description: The number of times the downtime is rescheduled; mutually exclusive with UntilDate

Active.description: Whether or not this downtime is currently active

Canceled.description: POSIX Timestamp of cancellation of this downtime (null if not canceled)

CreatorId.description: Id of the user who created this downtime

Disabled.description: Whether or not this downtime is disabled

End.description: POSIX timestamp to end the downtime. If not provided, the downtime is in effect indefinitely (i.e. until you cancel it).

MonitorId.description: A single monitor to which the downtime applies. If not provided, the downtime applies to all monitors.

MonitorTags.description: A comma-separated list of monitor tags, to which the downtime applies. The resulting downtime applies to monitors that match ALL provided monitor tags.

ParentId.description: The ID of the parent downtime to this one

Recurrence.description: An object defining the recurrence of the downtime with a variety of parameters

Scope.description: The scope(s) to which the downtime applies

Start.description: POSIX timestamp to start the downtime. If not provided, the downtime starts the moment it is created.

UpdaterId.description: Id of the user who updated this downtime
